title: Commercial sans-serif fonts / typefaces with slanted cuts or angled cuts taken out of the letter shapes?
content:
Not a type ID question as I don't have an example.

I am looking for sans serif fonts that have slanted or angled cuts taken out of the letters - a bit like the John Lewis logo.

Angles could be anything from 30 to 45 degrees.

I'm sure I've seen a few things but can't place them?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen shot 2014-03-29 at 15.48.19.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701111136/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20shot%202014-03-29%20at%2015.48.19.png) | 9.44 KB |
author: cool_hand

comments.content: I attached the image as an example, not looking for this specifically.

The most famous one is Interstate.

hhp

Oh, you \*are\* doing an ID...  
 [http://typophile.com/typeid](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701111136/http:/typophile.com/typeid "http://typophile.com/typeid")

hhp
no not an ID - looking for suggestions for fonts in the style I've described.

So "Def not Interstate" means that interstate doesn't meet your requirements? From your description it seems like a perfect fit - why don't you like it? Style, license, fear of driving on the freeway, something else?

I'm guessing he once had a falling out with Paula Sher. You know, the designer of the Citibank logo.

hhp
how did you know I fell out with old Paula?
Because I wanted to widen the gamut.
